body_content.explanation: to prove that a belief or an opinion is true:
examples: The failure of the book reconfirmed for publishers what they always knew.
The team's attitude has reconfirmed my belief that it is the best crew I have ever worked with.

body_content.explanation: to state an intention or wish very clearly, for the second time or more:
examples: The government has reconfirmed its commitment to increase foreign investment.
The manager yesterday reconfirmed his desire to keep the player at the club.

body_content.explanation: to make an arrangement or meeting certain, often by phone or writing, for the second time or more:
examples: Please reconfirm your visa requirements with your travel agent.
Allow extra time at the airport and reconfirm repeatedly.
